explanation: Uses a crafted ICMP echo request with a recognizable payload as a covert signal to activate remote behavior (similar to port knocking but via ICMP). Detection: alert on unusual ICMP payload signatures or short-interval bursts; analyze IDS/IPS logs for repeated identical ICMP payloads from administrative hosts.
rationale_steps: Create an ICMP payload with a static signature.
Send a single echo request with timeout suitable for signaling.
Remote listener may use payload match to trigger functionality.
Detect via ICMP payload inspection and anomaly detection for non-standard ping traffic.
